snippet: Court-appointed experts said the captain was primarily to blame for the deadly cruise ship accident that killed 32 people in January, but also faulted the crew and the shipowner.
abstract: Court-appointed experts say that Captain Francesco Schettino is primarily to blame for running aground the cruise ship Costa Concordia off the Tuscan island of Giglio, but also fault the crew and shipowner Costa Crociere for blunders.
lead_paragraph: Court-appointed experts said the captain was primarily to blame for the deadly cruise ship accident that killed 32 people in January, but also faulted the crew and the shipowner.

headline.main: Italy: Court Experts Broaden Blame in Cruise Ship Wreck Beyond Captain
headline.print_headline: Italy: Court Experts Broaden Blame In Cruise Ship Wreck Beyond Captain
